physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A 22-year-old man with JNCL had significant ocular findings at autopsy: a pale and waxy optic disc, a circumferential ring of bone spicule pigment in the midperiphery, and loss of photoreceptors from the macula and midperiphery.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient showed progressive visual impairment, starting with severe visual handicap and photophobia by age 3, developing into a bull's eye macular lesion and questionable optic disc pallor by age 5. By age 9, he had seizures and was diagnosed with JNCL, losing all visual function by the time of death.
